answerText: nitrogen gas [or N2] [10] The Frank-Caro process was an early method for nitrogen fixation, but was later replaced by this method, which directly added nitrogen gas to hydrogen gas in the presence of an iron catalyst.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 13 | 2 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The Frank-Caro process reacted this element's diatomic gas with calcium carbide. For 10 points each,  [10] Identify this element frequently added through a Schlenk line for inert environments.
